CREATURE.name: Wizard
CREATURE.significance: Wizards and witches are central to the narrative, driving the plot and forming the magical world.

CREATURE.name: Dark Lord
CREATURE.description: An evil wizard who killed Harry's parents.
CREATURE.significance: The main antagonist of the series, Voldemort's actions set the story in motion.

CREATURE.name: Muggle
CREATURE.significance: Muggles represent the ordinary world in contrast to the magical world, and Harry's upbringing with the Dursleys highlights this difference.

CREATURE.name: Ghost
CREATURE.description: Spirits of deceased wizards and witches that inhabit Hogwarts.
CREATURE.significance: Ghosts add to the magical atmosphere of Hogwarts and sometimes offer insights or guidance.

CREATURE.name: Three-headed dog
CREATURE.description: A monstrous dog named Fluffy that guards the trapdoor.
CREATURE.significance: Fluffy is one of the obstacles protecting the Philosopher's Stone.

CREATURE.name: Cat
CREATURE.description: Professor McGonagall can transform into a cat.
CREATURE.significance: McGonagall's animagus form allows her to observe events discreetly.

CREATURE.name: Owl
CREATURE.description: Used for delivering mail in the wizarding world.
CREATURE.significance: Owls are a common means of communication and transportation in the magical world.

CREATURE.name: Gorilla
CREATURE.description: An animal at the zoo that resembles Dudley.
CREATURE.significance: A humorous comparison highlighting Dudley's physical characteristics.

CREATURE.name: Boa Constrictor
CREATURE.description: A snake from Brazil that Harry sets free.
CREATURE.significance: The boa constrictor incident demonstrates Harry's unintentional magic.

CREATURE.name: Spider
CREATURE.description: Found in Harry's cupboard under the stairs.
CREATURE.significance: Spiders symbolize the neglect and unpleasantness of Harry's living conditions.

CREATURE.name: Goblin
CREATURE.description: Creatures that run Gringotts Wizarding Bank.
CREATURE.significance: Goblins play a crucial role in the wizarding economy and security.

CREATURE.name: Dragon
CREATURE.description: Magical creatures said to guard high-security vaults at Gringotts.
CREATURE.significance: Dragons are mentioned as powerful and dangerous creatures, adding to the mystique of Gringotts.

CREATURE.name: Troll
CREATURE.description: A large, dim-witted creature that enters Hogwarts.
CREATURE.significance: The troll incident solidifies the friendship between Harry, Ron, and Hermione.

CREATURE.name: Poltergeist
CREATURE.description: A mischievous spirit that causes trouble at Hogwarts.
CREATURE.significance: Peeves adds to the chaotic and unpredictable nature of Hogwarts.

CREATURE.name: Centaur
CREATURE.description: Creatures that live in the Forbidden Forest and have knowledge of the stars.
CREATURE.significance: Centaurs offer cryptic prophecies and warnings, adding a layer of mystery to the narrative.

CREATURE.name: Unicorn
CREATURE.description: A magical creature whose blood can keep someone alive at a terrible cost.
CREATURE.significance: The unicorn's death and the drinking of its blood highlight the desperation of Voldemort's quest for immortality.

CREATURE.name: Werewolf
CREATURE.description: Dangerous creatures mentioned as inhabiting the Forbidden Forest.
CREATURE.significance: Werewolves add to the sense of danger and mystery surrounding the Forbidden Forest.

CREATURE.name: Dragon
CREATURE.description: Hagrid illegally hatches a Norwegian Ridgeback dragon named Norbert.
CREATURE.significance: Norbert's presence creates further complications and risks for Harry and his friends.

EVENT.name: Harry's Hogwarts Letter Arrives
EVENT.summary: Harry Potter, an orphan living with his uncaring relatives, the Dursleys, receives a mysterious letter revealing his true identity as a wizard and his acceptance into Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. This marks the beginning of his journey into the magical world.

EVENT.name: Zoo Incident
EVENT.summary: During a visit to the zoo, Harry unknowingly communicates with a boa constrictor, causing the glass of its enclosure to disappear and the snake to escape. This event further hints at Harry's magical abilities.

EVENT.name: Barrage of Hogwarts Letters
EVENT.summary: The Dursleys try to prevent Harry from receiving more Hogwarts letters, but the letters arrive in increasingly bizarre ways, demonstrating the persistence of the magical world in contacting him.

EVENT.name: Hagrid's Arrival
EVENT.summary: Rubeus Hagrid, the half-giant gamekeeper of Hogwarts, arrives to personally deliver Harry's Hogwarts letter and inform him of his magical heritage and the truth about his parents' death.

EVENT.name: Trip to Diagon Alley
EVENT.summary: Hagrid takes Harry to Diagon Alley, a hidden magical shopping street, to purchase his school supplies, including his wand, robes, and books. Harry experiences the wonder of the wizarding world for the first time.

EVENT.name: Journey to Hogwarts
EVENT.summary: Harry travels to Hogwarts via the Hogwarts Express, departing from the concealed Platform Nine and Three-Quarters. He meets Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, who become his close friends.

EVENT.name: The Sorting Ceremony
EVENT.summary: Upon arrival at Hogwarts, Harry and the other first-year students participate in the Sorting Ceremony, where the Sorting Hat assigns them to their respective houses: Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, or Slytherin. Harry is sorted into Gryffindor.

EVENT.name: First Flying Lesson
EVENT.summary: Harry's natural talent for flying is revealed during his first flying lesson, leading to his selection as the Gryffindor Seeker, the youngest in a century.

EVENT.name: The Midnight Duel
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione encounter a troll in the dungeons on Halloween. They defeat the troll together, solidifying their friendship.

EVENT.name: Harry's First Quidditch Match
EVENT.summary: Harry plays his first Quidditch match against Slytherin, demonstrating exceptional skill and catching the Golden Snitch to secure a victory for Gryffindor.

EVENT.name: Discovering Nicolas Flamel
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione discover the identity of Nicolas Flamel, the creator of the Philosopher's Stone, and realize that the Stone is being kept at Hogwarts.

EVENT.name: Norbert the Dragon
EVENT.summary: Hagrid acquires a Norwegian Ridgeback dragon egg, which hatches and becomes a growing problem. Harry, Ron, and Hermione arrange for Charlie Weasley to take the dragon to Romania.

EVENT.name: The Forbidden Forest Incident
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, Hermione, Neville, and Malfoy serve detention in the Forbidden Forest, where they encounter a dying unicorn and a mysterious cloaked figure drinking its blood. Harry suspects Voldemort's involvement.

EVENT.name: Protecting the Stone
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione believe Snape is trying to steal the Philosopher's Stone and decide to take action. They overcome various magical obstacles set by the teachers to protect the Stone.

EVENT.name: Confronting Quirrell and Voldemort
EVENT.summary: Harry confronts Quirrell, who reveals that Voldemort is possessing him. Harry faces Voldemort and prevents him from obtaining the Philosopher's Stone, which is subsequently destroyed.

ORGANIZATION.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
ORGANIZATION.description: A school for young witches and wizards
ORGANIZATION.significance: The primary setting for the narrative and central to Harry's development as a wizard.

ORGANIZATION.name: Grunnings
ORGANIZATION.description: A company that makes drills, where Mr. Dursley works
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; establishes Mr. Dursley's character and the Dursleys' ordinary world.

ORGANIZATION.name: Ministry of Magic
ORGANIZATION.description: The governing body of the wizarding world in Britain
ORGANIZATION.significance: Mentioned as having offered Dumbledore the position of Minister and as a source of owls for Dumbledore.

ORGANIZATION.name: Order of Merlin
ORGANIZATION.description: A prestigious award in the wizarding world; Dumbledore is a First Class recipient

ORGANIZATION.name: International Confederation of Wizards
ORGANIZATION.description: A global organization of wizards; Dumbledore is the Supreme Mugwump

ORGANIZATION.name: Smeltings
ORGANIZATION.description: A private school for boys that Dudley attends
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; part of the contrast between Harry's and Dudley's lives.

ORGANIZATION.name: Stonewall High
ORGANIZATION.description: The local comprehensive school Harry is supposed to attend
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; part of the contrast between Harry's intended Muggle life and his wizarding destiny.

ORGANIZATION.name: Gryffindor
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for bravery, nerve, and chivalry
ORGANIZATION.significance: Harry's house; a source of belonging and identity.

ORGANIZATION.name: Hufflepuff
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for loyalty, hard work, and dedication
ORGANIZATION.significance: One of the houses at Hogwarts.

ORGANIZATION.name: Ravenclaw
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for intelligence, learning, and wisdom
ORGANIZATION.significance: One of the houses at Hogwarts.

ORGANIZATION.name: Slytherin
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for ambition, cunning, and resourcefulness
ORGANIZATION.significance: The house associated with Voldemort and Malfoy; often seen as antagonistic to Gryffindor.

ORGANIZATION.name: Gringotts
ORGANIZATION.description: The wizarding bank run by goblins
ORGANIZATION.significance: Where Harry's fortune is kept; plays a role in the mystery of the Philosopher's Stone.

ORGANIZATION.name: Warlocks' Convention
ORGANIZATION.description: Mentioned in relation to the outlawing of dragon breeding in 1709
ORGANIZATION.significance: Explains the illegality of Hagrid's dragon, Norbert.

ITEM.name: Letter to Harry
ITEM.description: A letter written in emerald green ink on yellowish parchment, delivered by owl post, informing Harry Potter of his acceptance into Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
ITEM.origin: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

ITEM.name: Put-Outer
ITEM.description: A silver cigarette lighter-like device used by Albus Dumbledore to extinguish street lamps.

ITEM.name: Sherbet lemon
ITEM.description: A type of Muggle sweet that Dumbledore enjoys.

ITEM.name: Half-moon spectacles
ITEM.description: Worn by Albus Dumbledore.

ITEM.name: Golden watch
ITEM.description: A watch with twelve hands and planets instead of numbers, owned by Dumbledore.

ITEM.name: Flying motorbike
ITEM.description: A motorbike capable of flight, borrowed by Hagrid from Sirius Black.

ITEM.name: Bundle of blankets
ITEM.description: Used to wrap baby Harry Potter.

ITEM.name: Smeltings stick
ITEM.description: A knobbly stick carried by Smeltings schoolboys, used for hitting each other.

ITEM.name: Sellotape
ITEM.description: Used to hold together Harry's broken glasses.

ITEM.name: Lemon ice lolly
ITEM.description: A cheap treat bought for Harry at the zoo.

ITEM.name: Knickerbocker glory
ITEM.description: An ice cream dish that Dudley enjoys.

ITEM.name: Wizard coins
ITEM.description: Galleons (gold), Sickles (silver), and Knuts (bronze).

ITEM.name: Canary-yellow circus tent
ITEM.description: A knitted item Hagrid works on during the train ride.

ITEM.name: Daily Prophet
ITEM.description: The newspaper of the wizarding world.

ITEM.name: School robes
ITEM.description: Plain black work robes worn by Hogwarts students.
ITEM.origin: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions

ITEM.name: Pointed hat
ITEM.description: A plain black hat for day wear at Hogwarts.
ITEM.origin: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions

ITEM.name: Protective gloves
ITEM.description: Dragon hide or similar.

ITEM.name: Winter cloak
ITEM.description: Black with silver fastenings.
ITEM.origin: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions

ITEM.name: School books
ITEM.description: Textbooks on various magical subjects.

ITEM.name: Wand
ITEM.description: Harry's wand is made of holly and phoenix feather, 11 inches long.

ITEM.name: Cauldron
ITEM.description: A pewter cauldron for potion-making.

ITEM.name: Phials
ITEM.description: Glass or crystal phials for storing potions ingredients.

ITEM.name: Telescope
ITEM.description: A brass telescope for astronomy classes.

ITEM.name: Brass scales
ITEM.description: Used for weighing potion ingredients.

ITEM.name: Snowy owl
ITEM.description: Harry's pet owl, named Hedwig.

ITEM.name: Chocolate cake
ITEM.description: Hagrid's birthday gift to Harry.

ITEM.name: Remembrall
ITEM.description: A small glass ball filled with white smoke that turns red when its owner has forgotten something.

ITEM.name: Nimbus Two Thousand
ITEM.description: Harry's high-quality broomstick.

ITEM.name: Cleansweep Seven
ITEM.description: Mentioned as a possible broomstick for Harry.

ITEM.name: Bertie Bott's Every-Flavour Beans
ITEM.description: Beans with every flavour imaginable, including some unpleasant ones.

ITEM.name: Chocolate Frogs
ITEM.description: Chocolate treats that come with collectible cards of famous witches and wizards.

ITEM.name: Weasley jumper
ITEM.description: A hand-knitted jumper Mrs. Weasley makes for Harry.

ITEM.name: Invisibility Cloak
ITEM.description: A cloak that makes the wearer invisible.

ITEM.name: Wizard crackers
ITEM.description: Crackers that explode with a bang and release magical items.

ITEM.name: Dragon egg
ITEM.description: A Norwegian Ridgeback dragon egg Hagrid wins in a card game.

ITEM.name: Fluffy
ITEM.description: A three-headed dog owned by Hagrid, guarding the trapdoor to the Philosopher's Stone.
ITEM.origin: Bought by Hagrid from a Greek man

ITEM.name: Norbert
ITEM.description: Hagrid's pet Norwegian Ridgeback dragon.

ITEM.name: Philosopher's Stone
ITEM.description: A legendary substance that can turn metal into gold and produce the Elixir of Life.

ITEM.name: Mirror of Erised
ITEM.description: A mirror that shows the viewer their deepest desires.

CHARACTER.name: Harry Potter
CHARACTER.description: Unhappy orphan, skinny, black hair, green eyes, round glasses, lightning bolt scar on forehead.

CHARACTER.name: Vernon Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Large, beefy man with a moustache, director of Grunnings.

CHARACTER.name: Petunia Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Thin, blonde, nosy woman, Harry's aunt.

CHARACTER.name: Albus Dumbledore
CHARACTER.description: Tall, thin, very old, silver hair and beard, half-moon spectacles, long robes, Headmaster of Hogwarts.

CHARACTER.name: Minerva McGonagall
CHARACTER.description: Severe-looking woman, square glasses, black hair in a bun, emerald robes, Deputy Headmistress.

CHARACTER.name: Rubeus Hagrid
CHARACTER.description: Twice as tall as a normal man, wild, bushy black hair and beard, hands the size of dustbin lids.

CHARACTER.name: Dedalus Diggle
CHARACTER.description: Man in a violet top hat.

CHARACTER.name: Quirinus Quirrell
CHARACTER.description: Pale young man, twitching eye, wears a turban.

CHARACTER.name: Madam Malkin
CHARACTER.description: Squat, smiling, dressed in mauve, owns robe shop.

CHARACTER.name: Draco Malfoy
CHARACTER.description: Pale boy, pointed face, drawling voice.

CHARACTER.name: Ron Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Tall, thin, gangling, freckles, big hands and feet, long nose, red hair.

CHARACTER.name: Fred Weasley
CHARACTER.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers.

CHARACTER.name: George Weasley
CHARACTER.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers.

CHARACTER.name: Neville Longbottom
CHARACTER.description: Round-faced boy, often loses his toad.

CHARACTER.name: Hermione Granger
CHARACTER.description: Bushy brown hair, large front teeth, very clever.

CHARACTER.name: Bloody Baron
CHARACTER.description: Slytherin ghost, covered in silver blood.

CHARACTER.name: Oliver Wood
CHARACTER.description: Burly fifth-year boy, Gryffindor Quidditch captain.

CHARACTER.name: Severus Snape
CHARACTER.description: Greasy black hair, hooked nose, sallow skin, teaches Potions.

CHARACTER.name: Ronan
CHARACTER.description: Red hair and beard, chestnut body.

CHARACTER.name: Bane
CHARACTER.description: Black hair and body, wilder-looking than Ronan.

CHARACTER.name: Firenze
CHARACTER.description: Younger centaur, white-blond hair, palomino body, astonishingly blue eyes.

CHARACTER.name: Lord Voldemort
CHARACTER.description: Chalk-white face, glaring red eyes, slits for nostrils.

LOCATION.name: Privet Drive
LOCATION.description: A quiet, ordinary suburban street where the Dursleys live at number four. It is described as tidy and neat, with well-maintained gardens.  The street represents the mundane, non-magical world that Harry comes from.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's childhood home with the Dursleys, representing his difficult upbringing and contrast with the wizarding world.

LOCATION.name: Number Four, Privet Drive
LOCATION.description: The Dursleys' home, a perfectly ordinary suburban house. Inside, it is filled with Dudley's possessions and lacks any indication of Harry's existence or magical background. The house is a symbol of Harry's unhappy childhood and the Dursleys' attempts to suppress his magic.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's unhappy childhood home with the Dursleys, a place of neglect and contrast to the warmth and acceptance he finds at Hogwarts.

LOCATION.name: Cupboard under the Stairs
LOCATION.description: Harry's small, spider-infested bedroom under the stairs. It symbolizes his low status within the Dursley household and their disregard for his well-being.
LOCATION.significance: Symbol of Harry's neglect and mistreatment by the Dursleys.

LOCATION.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
LOCATION.description: A magical boarding school for young witches and wizards, filled with moving staircases, talking portraits, ghosts, and hidden passages. Hogwarts is a place of learning, adventure, and friendship for Harry.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's new home and school, a place of wonder and belonging where he learns about his magical heritage and makes lifelong friends.

LOCATION.name: Diagon Alley
LOCATION.description: A hidden wizarding shopping street accessible through the Leaky Cauldron. It is where witches and wizards purchase their school supplies, including wands, robes, and books.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's first introduction to the wizarding world and its wonders.

LOCATION.name: The Leaky Cauldron
LOCATION.description: A small, grubby pub that serves as the entrance to Diagon Alley. It is a gathering place for witches and wizards.
LOCATION.significance: Gateway to Diagon Alley and the wizarding world.

LOCATION.name: Gringotts Wizarding Bank
LOCATION.description: The only bank in the wizarding world, run by goblins. It is located deep underground and is said to be guarded by dragons.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry learns about his inheritance and the existence of the Philosopher's Stone.

LOCATION.name: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions
LOCATION.description: A shop in Diagon Alley where witches and wizards purchase their robes.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry meets Draco Malfoy for the first time.

LOCATION.name: Eeylops Owl Emporium
LOCATION.description: A shop that sells owls and other magical creatures.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry buys Hedwig, his snowy owl.

LOCATION.name: Flourish and Blotts
LOCATION.description: A bookshop in Diagon Alley that sells a wide variety of magical books.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry buys his school books.

LOCATION.name: Ollivanders
LOCATION.description: A wand shop owned by Garrick Ollivander, who is known for his expertise in matching wizards with their wands.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry receives his wand, which shares a core with Voldemort's.

LOCATION.name: Platform Nine and Three-Quarters
LOCATION.description: A hidden platform at King's Cross Station from which the Hogwarts Express departs.
LOCATION.significance: The point of departure for Hogwarts, marking Harry's entry into the magical world.

LOCATION.name: Hogwarts Express
LOCATION.description: The train that takes students to and from Hogwarts.
LOCATION.significance: Mode of transport to Hogwarts, where Harry meets Ron and Hermione.

LOCATION.name: The Great Hall
LOCATION.description: The main dining hall at Hogwarts, where students eat meals and attend important ceremonies like the Sorting Ceremony.
LOCATION.significance: Location of the Sorting Ceremony and many other important events.

LOCATION.name: Gryffindor Common Room
LOCATION.description: A cozy, circular room with squashy armchairs where Gryffindor students relax and socialize.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's house common room, a place of comfort and camaraderie.

LOCATION.name: Hagrid's Hut
LOCATION.description: A small wooden house on the edge of the Forbidden Forest where Hagrid, the gamekeeper, lives.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry and his friends often visit Hagrid for tea and advice.

LOCATION.name: Quidditch Pitch
LOCATION.description: The field where Quidditch matches are played.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry practices and plays Quidditch.

LOCATION.name: The Forbidden Forest
LOCATION.description: A dark and dangerous forest on the Hogwarts grounds that is forbidden to students.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry encounters Voldemort drinking unicorn blood and learns about the dangers lurking in the magical world.

LOCATION.name: Room 17
LOCATION.description: A room in a gloomy hotel where the Dursleys and Harry stay while trying to escape the Hogwarts letters.
LOCATION.significance: A temporary hiding place for the Dursleys.

LOCATION.name: Hut-on-the-Rock
LOCATION.description: A miserable little shack on a rock in the sea where the Dursleys take Harry for his eleventh birthday in a final attempt to escape the Hogwarts letters.
LOCATION.significance: Where Hagrid finds Harry and reveals his magical heritage.

LOCATION.name: Hogsmeade
LOCATION.description: A wizarding village near Hogwarts.
LOCATION.significance: Mentioned as the location of the Hog's Head pub.

LOCATION.name: The Hog's Head
LOCATION.description: A pub in Hogsmeade where Hagrid won Norbert the dragon egg.
LOCATION.significance: Where Hagrid encounters the stranger who gives him Norbert.

LOCATION.name: Mirror of Erised room
LOCATION.description: A disused classroom where Harry finds the Mirror of Erised.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry sees his family for the first time and learns about his deepest desires.

LOCATION.name: Hospital Wing
LOCATION.description: The infirmary at Hogwarts, run by Madam Pomfrey.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry recovers after his encounter with Quirrell and Voldemort.
